marklogic.body: "Hush" • Oh, God, the episode menu is one of the Gentlemen looking straight at the camera with that rictus grin. • "A typical college girl, one assumes." "Lbh'er whfg n tvey..." "Gung'f jung V xrrc fnlvat." • "Or n tbbq obl." Bu, Tbq. • "If I kiss you, it'll make the sun go down." Dreams are WEIRD. • "And the last twenty minutes just laid out everything I need to know for the final. I'd hate to have missed that." Willow, keep teasing Buffy forever. • "You mean an orgasm friend?" "Yes, that's exactly the most appaling thing you could have said." That's what makes her Anya. • Tara being too afraid of being laughed at to come to Willow's defense = Me sad. :( • "Xander, don't you care about me?" "Shut up." In an episode that's largely silent, there's still a lot of great lines. • I love this description of the Gentlemen from the shooting script: "He's old, bone white, bald -- Nosferatu meets Hellraiser by way of the Joker. Actually, he looks kind of like Mr. Burns, except he can't stop his rictus-grin, and his teeth are gleaming metal." • Love the phone call, and Spike's condescending look when the inevitable happens. • "Lethal countermeasures engaged." Well, so much for Riley. And I thought he and Buffy might make a cute... oh, they're fine. Never mind. • "In case of emergency use stairway." Ha. • If they were still in high school, it would have been Wbanguna who dropped the bottle. • It's "Revelation." No S. • "Hi Giles" Aww. • "...recent Flu vaccinations... citywide hoax..." I wonder if the cover story was concocted by (or in response to reports from) the Initiative. • I don't really find the Gentlemen scary, personally. (I understand why they are. And I don't hold it against the episode that I'm able to find the scary monsters not-scary.) But if one floated by my window at night, looking in with that grin... yeah, I'd close the curtains and scream. Or, you know, try to scream because I couldn't speak. Unless they were getting really sloppy and skipped the stealing voices part. • There's the music from the episode menu on the DVDs. Should have figured it was from this episode, the DVD is all "Hush"-branded. • Oh, God. The newspaper Giles is looking at... the text is from The Onion. (WHY do I check stuff like this?) • "Danse Macabre!" This scene is one of my favorites. Just... funny and infodumpy all at once. • Okay, WHY do the Gentlemen need seven hearts? What happens if they GET them? • I don't know which image makes me laugh more: the one where Giles went all-out with the red marker or the one with the Gentlemen dancing to a Victrola. Or the unflattering drawing of Buffy. • For some reason, I keep typing "Gentlement." I wish I knew why. • Tara's directory of Stevenson Hall is different from the one Spike looked through in "The Initiative." • Why isn't Riley wearing his mask? • Xander, Anya, I love you both and wish you all the best. • Lrc, guvf vf oyvaqvatyl boivbhf gb gur cbvag V pna'g oryvrir vg gbbx fbzrbar ryfr cbfgvat n zrffntr obneq guernq nobhg "Jvyybj naq gur oybaqr tvey ubyqvat unaqf" orsber V fnj vg. • "I just thought you were being pretentious." "Oh, I was. I was also right." Yes, the two aren't mutually exclusive. • "I guess we have to talk." "I guess we do." I try not to just drop quotes in these without some sort of commentary. For this, I'm having trouble coming up with anything to say. Which, given what I'm commenting on, is highly appropriate. • They should have had the Mutant Enemy zombie be silent this time. Body Count: • Student, killed by the Gentlemen. • (Offscreen) Now-heartless person, killed by the Gentlemen. • (Offscreen) 15-Year-Old Girl, killed by the Gentlemen. • Footman, killed by Buffy. • (Offscreen) Student, killed by the Gentlemen. • (Offscreen) Now-heartless person, killed by the Gentlemen. • Six Gentlemen, killed by Buffy. • At least three footmen, killed by Buffy. [There may be a sixth victim of the Gentlemen; they had five hearts on the table. Tara found a Gentleman holding a heart, but there's really no way of knowing if that's one that made it to the table. Given that all the Gentlemen we saw were present for Buffy's scream, I would assume it did.]
